intro: Epilobium glaucum f. stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, stream banks, and meadows. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitats.
